posts.cooked: We are having trouble getting the 1/2 inch hub colson wheels onto vex 1/2 inch thunderhex shafts. Are they not supposed to be compatible?

posts.name: Joshua Yang
posts.cooked: I would suggest you try sanding or filling the shaft a little bit, sometimes there is still a bit of a difference maybe by just a few fractions of a millimetre. Start sanding it little by little until you can fit it in.

posts.name: Rocky
posts.cooked: Use a hex brocher for the wheel, and chamfer the start of the hex shaft?

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked:
I assume that you’re using the Colsons with the 1/2 hex hub?    We are using the same wheels on the same shafts.  It’s a snug fit, which is probably a good thing.

We got ours in the right place with trigger-clamps (one end on the shaft end, the other on the wheel).

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Ours have always ended up obnoxiously tight on hex shaft. We have to always broach ours out to fit nicely.

The “Poor Mans Broach” is a tapered piece of hex stock jammed through the hole with a press. This works okay with softer plastics, will not with metal

posts.name: AgentSmith451
posts.cooked:
kingc95:

The “Poor Mans Broach”

I made a halfway decent one once from some steel hex and frankly too much time with an angle grinder to cut teeth in it. It wouldn’t cut a hex starting from a circle, but it did work well to adjust tight-fitting hex components.

We’ve since graduated to a real broach. It’s much better.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
